private_information: I may move only disks A, B, C, D, E.
I will never propose moves for disks F, G, H, I, J, K, L, M, N, O.
agent_1.goal: Contribute legal Tower of Hanoi moves so that disk A ends on the right peg while all larger disks B..O remain stacked on the left peg.

private_information: I may move only disks F, G, H, I, J.
I will never propose moves for disks A, B, C, D, E, K, L, M, N, O.
agent_2.goal: Contribute legal Tower of Hanoi moves when needed; do not touch smaller disks unless allowed; preserve the invariant that no larger disk is placed on a smaller one.

private_information: I may move only disks K, L, M, N, O.
I will never propose moves for disks A, B, C, D, E, F, G, H, I, J.
agent_3.goal: Contribute legal Tower of Hanoi moves when needed; keep the base stack stable unless coordination requires otherwise; never place a larger disk on a smaller one.

private_information: I audit temporal and causal consistency across all proposed moves.
I remove or flag any bookkeeping shortcuts such as hidden counters, quota tokens, or post-hoc penalties.
I verify that each move respects agent authority, Tower of Hanoi constraints, and maintains the declared invariants.
auditor.goal: Ensure that the integrated plan is minimal, legal, consistent, and free of bookkeeping artifacts; certify the final ordered move list.

private_information: I coordinate agent proposals and audits into a single consistent plan.
I produce a final PDDL domain and problem suitable for the Fast Downward planner.
orchestrator.goal: Integrate the agents' analyses, produce the final ordered list of primitive moves, and generate a clean STRIPS PDDL domain and problem compatible with Fast Downward that encodes this instance.

rules: Only one disk can be moved at a time.
A move consists of taking the top disk from one peg and placing it on top of another peg or on a disk that is larger.
No disk may be placed on top of a smaller disk.

public_information: Three pegs are available: left, middle, right.
Disks are labeled A (smallest) through O (largest).
Initial configuration: left peg has top to bottom A, B, C, D, E, F, G, H, I, J, K, L, M, N, O; middle peg is empty; right peg is empty.
Goal configuration: left peg has top to bottom B, C, D, E, F, G, H, I, J, K, L, M, N, O; middle peg is empty; right peg has top to bottom A.
Agent movement restrictions: agent_1 may move A, B, C, D, E; agent_2 may move F, G, H, I, J; agent_3 may move K, L, M, N, O.
All agents must obey Tower of Hanoi rules.
Total order by size: A < B < C < D < E < F < G < H < I < J < K < L < M < N < O.

ordered_moves: agent_1: move disk A from left to right
reference_solution.justification: Disk A is on the top of the left peg; moving A directly to the right peg achieves the goal while leaving the stack B..O on the left peg unchanged and respecting agent authority and Tower of Hanoi rules.

local_analysis.system_prompt: You assess the current Tower of Hanoi instance and identify which legal moves you alone may perform, focusing on disks A, B, C, D, E.
local_analysis.prompt: Your name is agent_1. Given the public information {environment->public_information} and the initial and goal states {environment->state_encoding}, enumerate legal candidate moves that you can execute now and highlight any invariants you will maintain.

proposal.system_prompt: You draft a concise move proposal that respects your disk authority and Tower of Hanoi legality.
proposal.prompt: Build a short proposal for the first steps toward the goal using only disks A, B, C, D, E and explain why it is legal and sufficient from the initial configuration.

local_analysis.system_prompt: You assess whether any moves involving disks F, G, H, I, J are necessary to support the stated goal.
local_analysis.prompt: Your name is agent_2. Using the public information {environment->public_information}, state whether any of your disks must be moved to achieve the goal and justify your answer. If no move is needed, explicitly say no-op.

local_analysis.system_prompt: You assess whether any moves involving disks K, L, M, N, O are necessary to support the stated goal.
local_analysis.prompt: Your name is agent_3. Using the public information {environment->public_information}, state whether any of your disks must be moved to achieve the goal and justify your answer. If no move is needed, explicitly say no-op.

pre_audit.system_prompt: You check for temporal and causal consistency, legality under Tower of Hanoi rules, and authority constraints before orchestration.
pre_audit.prompt: Audit the proposed or implied moves from all agents for legality, causality, and minimality. Reject any shortcuts such as token bookkeeping or skipped preconditions.

post_audit.system_prompt: You certify the final ordered move list, confirming it exactly achieves the goal without illegal steps or hidden bookkeeping.
post_audit.prompt: Validate the final ordered move list against the initial and goal states and certify that each move is legal, agent-authorized, and necessary.

integrate.system_prompt: You coordinate multi-agent puzzle solving and assemble a single coherent plan.
integrate.prompt: Integrate agent contributions and the pre-audit into a coherent minimal plan that achieves the goal configuration. Clearly state whether each non-agent_1 group needs to move.

move_list.system_prompt: You output the final ordered list of primitive moves in the specified format.
move_list.prompt: Produce the ordered list of primitive moves using the exact format: 'agent_i: move disk X from peg1 to peg2'. Respect agent authorities and Tower of Hanoi rules. Use peg names left, middle, right.

pddl.system_prompt: You are an expert in generating STRIPS PDDL for the Fast Downward solver. You always provide a PDDL domain and a PDDL problem file, enclosed within <domain></domain> and <problem></problem> tags, using typed objects and no ADL or durative actions.
pddl.prompt: Generate a clean PDDL domain and problem for this exact 3-peg, 15-disk Tower of Hanoi instance consistent with {environment->state_encoding}. Use types disk and peg; predicates on-peg, on-disk, clear-disk, clear-peg, smaller; and four move actions: peg->peg, peg->disk, disk->peg, disk->disk with STRIPS preconditions and effects. Ensure compatibility with Fast Downward. Enclose the PDDL domain within <domain></domain> and the PDDL problem within <problem></problem>.
